newsitem.title: FINLAND: KESKO MARCH SALES UP 50.9 PCT YR/YR.
newsitem.headline: KESKO MARCH SALES UP 50.9 PCT YR/YR.

text.p: Finnish wholesaler and retailer Kesko Oy said in a statement on Tuesday that group March sales excluding value-added-tax (VAT) increased 50.9 percent year-on-year to 3.58 billion markka.

Domestic sales excluding Tuko, which Kesko acquired last year but is now about to sell most of to restore competition on the daily goods market as required by the EU, fell 2.4 percent year-on-year to 2.12 billion markka, it said.
International sales surged 163 percent to 530 million markka, of which Kaukomarkkinat -- bought last May -- accounted for 298 million.
